definition.value: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value:
Example: First Outpatient
Each Service supports one and only one Appointment Type.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Supported Appointment Type

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

comment.value: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...). OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.

requirements.value: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Version of the system - if relevant

definition.value: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

comment.value: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

definition.value: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

requirements.value: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

requirements.value: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know the system.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

map.value: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

short.value: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

definition.value: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

comment.value: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.

requirements.value: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Services can support one or two Request Flow Types, but not Triage Request and Appointment Request simultaneously.

definition.value: Services that are shortlisted for a Referral must support either the Triage Request or Appointment Request flow.

short.value: Statistical indication of how long Patients have waited before receiving treatment.

definition.value:
Values are expressed in weeks.
If the likely forecast for the treatment wait time exceeds 18 weeks, the value âLOWâ will be returned instead. (LOW - Limited Capacity)

description.value: Capacity Alert

short.value: Whether the service is Directly or Indirectly Bookable.

definition.value:
If a Service is marked as Directly Bookable then Appointments into the Service can be booked via e-RS and via the Patient Application.
If a Service is marked as Indirectly Bookable then the Patient will need to contact the clinic following the booking instructions for the Service.
Services that donât support Appointments (i.e. Advice and Guidance and Triage), are marked as Unspecified.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

comment.value: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...). OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.

requirements.value: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Version of the system - if relevant

definition.value: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

comment.value: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

definition.value: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

requirements.value: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

requirements.value: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know the system.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

map.value: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

short.value: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

definition.value: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

comment.value: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.

requirements.value: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

map.value: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map; fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [ fhir:source "true"; fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O ]

short.value: Additional support services provided by the Organisation where the Service is located at.

definition.value: Additional support services provided by the Organisation where the Service is located at. Restrictions may apply, i.e. if a Service is marked as being able to provide an interpreter, they may have specified that they only support selected languages â this detail is not included here.

short.value: Indicates whether the Service requires a referral letter before they consider a referral to be valid.

definition.value:
Indicates whether the Service requires a referral letter before they consider a referral to be valid.
Only applicable for Services that support the Appointment Request or the Triage Request flows.
If a Service with referralLetterRequired = True is shortlisted, the User will need to indicate that they intend to add a referral letter when creating a referral or updating the shortlist (unless a referral letter is already present)

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value:
Example: First Outpatient
Each Service supports one and only one Appointment Type.

description.value: Supported Appointment Type

short.value: Services can support one or two Request Flow Types, but not Triage Request and Appointment Request simultaneously.

definition.value: Services that are shortlisted for a Referral must support either the Triage Request or Appointment Request flow.

description.value: Request Flow Type

short.value: Statistical indication of how long Patients have waited before receiving treatment.

definition.value:
Values are expressed in weeks.
If the likely forecast for the treatment wait time exceeds 18 weeks, the value âLOWâ will be returned instead. (LOW - Limited Capacity)

description.value: Capacity Alert

short.value: Whether the service is Directly or Indirectly Bookable.

definition.value:
If a Service is marked as Directly Bookable then Appointments into the Service can be booked via e-RS and via the Patient Application.
If a Service is marked as Indirectly Bookable then the Patient will need to contact the clinic following the booking instructions for the Service.
Services that donât support Appointments (i.e. Advice and Guidance and Triage), are marked as Unspecified.

short.value: Link to NHS website providing information about the Service such as contact details, map, department, facilities and reviews.

definition.value: Link to NHS website providing information about the Service such as contact details, map, department, facilities and reviews.
Service location
Referrer Alert
Suggested Investigations.
Conditions treated
Age range treated; it can be expressed in months or years and the range may be an open interval where only the start or only the end are specified. The min and max age treated are inclusive.
Gender treated; it can be male, female or both.

description.value: Gender Treated

short.value: Additional support services provided by the Organisation where the Service is located at.

definition.value: Additional support services provided by the Organisation where the Service is located at. Restrictions may apply, i.e. if a Service is marked as being able to provide an interpreter, they may have specified that they only support selected languages â this detail is not included here.

description.value: Additional Requirement Supported

short.value: Indicates whether the Service requires a referral letter before they consider a referral to be valid.

definition.value:
Indicates whether the Service requires a referral letter before they consider a referral to be valid.
Only applicable for Services that support the Appointment Request or the Triage Request flows.
If a Service with referralLetterRequired = True is shortlisted, the User will need to indicate that they intend to add a referral letter when creating a referral or updating the shortlist (unless a referral letter is already present)

short.value: The specialty supported by the Service

definition.value: The specialty supported by the Service.
